Construction has to be gone on a new bridge connecting Detroit to Windsor, Ontario the Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau and Michigan governor Rick Snyder attended the groundbreaking ceremony and Detroit dang carpet Chuck reports the Detroit Windsor border is being described as a key link between the two countries
According to how international bridge named after the Canadian border hockey legend is expected to cost more than five billion dollars they will rebuild over the next six years and scheduled to be operational by the end of twenty twenty four Trudeau says the bridge about a mile and a half long provided critical trade connection
And taking on even more important now that Canada the U.S and Mexico have agreed in principle to a new free trade agreement that Canadian Prime minister says the new bridge has been a long time in coming it means shorter travel times more efficient supply chains in increased to way commerce the bridge was controversial until the previous Canadian government agreed
To finance all of the project and we'll also create about twenty five hundred jobs for NPR News I'm Dan carp and check in Toronto and on trial Snyder in Washington
